definition: to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: There was no territorial incursion, the ministry said.
sentences.chinese: 没有入侵领土，防卫省说道。

sentences.english: The Russians eventually won, invading the city in 1868.
sentences.chinese: 俄国最后赢了，于1898年入侵了布哈拉。

sentences.english: European influence gradually brought an end to this regional power.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲势力的逐渐地入侵，结束了这种地域性的霸权。

sentences.english: I also went to Gaza before the last Israeli incursion a couple of years ago.
sentences.chinese: 几年前，以色列最后一次入侵加沙之前我到过那里。

sentences.english: Russia accuses Georgia of secretly massing troops for an invasion of Abkhazia.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯指责格鲁吉亚秘密集结军队入侵阿布哈兹。

sentences.english: Uptight men drink alcohol and invade another country.
sentences.chinese: 紧张的男人喝白酒，入侵别国。

sentences.english: So the invasion from an enemy country irritated an Italian scientist.
sentences.chinese: 因此来自一个敌国的入侵激怒了一名意大利的科学家。

sentences.english: In the background are the battleships of the U.S. fleet that made up the invasion task force. (AP Photo)
sentences.chinese: 图片背景是执行入侵作战任务的美舰队的战舰。

sentences.english: The British army so large-scalely invades and depart his mainland again at present.
sentences.chinese: 英军这么大规模的入侵，离他的本土又这么远。

sentences.english: The labyrinths were supposed to confound any enemies who might get in.
sentences.chinese: 迷宫应该是为了迷惑入侵的敌人而建。

sentences.english: For the Russian people, it brought unspeakable suffering.
sentences.chinese: 对俄罗斯人民来说，这场入侵带来了无法形容的苦难。

sentences.english: Sixty thousand Prussians invaded Denmark in February.
sentences.chinese: 六万普鲁士人于二月入侵了丹麦。

sentences.english: Present-day Species Of Piranha Resulted From Marine Incursion Into Amazon Basin.
sentences.chinese: 现代水虎是海水入侵亚马逊盆地的结果”。

sentences.english: This model can increase the detection rate and decrease the pseudo fault report rate.
sentences.chinese: 此模型能够提高入侵检测的检测率，减少误报率。

sentences.english: The town was pillaged by the invading army.
sentences.chinese: 入侵的军队将该城镇掠夺一空。

sentences.english: Witchweed is very difficult to remove if it invades an area.
sentences.chinese: 如果它入侵了一个地区是非常难以清除的。

definition: to make (military) incursions/to invade/to intrude into/to trespass/to gain unauthorized access (computing)
to put an end to/to annihilate/to cause to perish/to perish/annihilation (in quantum field theory)
to seize control of (an enemy position)/(fig.) to take by storm/to gain (awards, control of a market etc)
to attack/to accuse/to charge/an attack (terrorist or military)
to overcome/to take (a fortress)/to fall (to an attack)/to surrender
to disturb/to cause a commotion/to harass
